_header: In the month of May when the grass groweth green
Title(s): On the Death of the Duke of Suffolk (1450)
Subjects: de la Pole, William, duke of Suffolk; historical poems; satires; parodies
_description: On the Death of the Duke of Suffolk (1450) — macaronic lines in 8-line stanzas (ababbcbc), with refrain, ‘For Iac Napes soule, Placebo and Dirige’

BLCottVesBXVI.First Lines:
In the moneth of Maii when grasse groweþ greneFlagrant in her
                    floures with swete sauour…
BLCottVesBXVI.Last Lines:
…And þat all Englond ioyfull may syngeþe
                    commendacion with Placebo & Dirige

Lam306.First Lines:
In the moneth of may whan gres growes grenefragrans in there
                    floures with a swet savor…
Lam306.Last Lines:
…for all the fals traytors þat engelond hath soldAnd for
                    Jake napis sowlle placebo and dirige finis Amen
Lam306.Attributed Title:
here folowythe a dyrge made by the comons of Kent / in the tyme of ther
                    Rysynge when Jake Cade was theyr cappitayn
Lam306.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,

Camden Society
         n.s. 28 (1880): 99.

TCD516.First Lines:
In the monyth of may qwan gresse waxyt greneffragrans in there
                    flowres with a swete sauour…
TCD516.Last Lines:
…Amen all Ingelond doth Cryeffor all these tratourrys sowlys
                        placebo & dirigeffor iake napys sowle placebo &
                        dirige
